DOCNAME: CASE OF DELLE CAVE AND CORRADO v. ITALY
CONCLUSION: Violation de l'art. 6-1;Non-violation de l'art. 13;Préjudice moral - réparation pécuniaire;Remboursement frais et dépens - procédure de la Convention;Frais et dépens (procédure nationale) - demande rejetée
JUDGES: András Baka;Antonella Mularoni;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE ( GPE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants , acting both in their own names and as representatives of their son ORG , then a minor , sued the insurance company NORP and Mr GPE in GPE ORG , seeking to obtain compensation for damage sustained by their son in a road traffic accident .

CARDINAL . Preparation of the case for hearing began on DATE . CARDINAL hearings were initially scheduled for DATE but were adjourned : CARDINAL of the court 's own motion and the other for examination of evidence .

CARDINAL . At a hearing of CARDINAL DATE , upon the applicants ' request , the judge in charge of preparations for trial ordered the transmission of the case file to ORG ( GPE ) , which assumed jurisdiction ratione loci .

CARDINAL . The case was set down for a first hearing before that court as late as DATE . CARDINAL hearings scheduled to take place DATE and DATE were adjourned : CARDINAL for examination of evidence , CARDINAL of the court 's own motion , CARDINAL because ORG , who had in the meantime reached his majority , had joined the proceedings in his own name before ORG , and CARDINAL in order to allow the parties to make their submissions . The hearing of submissions was then scheduled for CARDINAL DATE . However , finding that the defendant had not been informed of a change in the judge in charge of preparations for trial , the new judge adjourned the case until DATE . The hearing of submissions finally took place on DATE and judgment was reserved .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , the text of which was deposited in the court 's registry on DATE , ORG allowed the claims of the applicants and their son .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an application with ORG under PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE , known as the “ Pinto Act ” , complaining of the excessive length of the above - described proceedings . The applicants requested the court to conclude that there had been a violation of LAW and to order ORG to pay compensation for the pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage that they claimed to have sustained . Each applicant sought , inter alia , MONEY ( ORG ) for pecuniary damage and ORG MONEY for non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE , the text of which was deposited in the court 's registry on DATE , ORG found that the length of the proceedings had been unreasonable . Dismissing their claim in respect of pecuniary damage on the ground that the applicants had not adduced any evidence in that connection , it awarded each applicant the sum of ORG MONEY , determined on an equitable basis , in respect of non - pecuniary damage and LAW for costs and expenses . This decision was served on the authorities on DATE and became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicants did not appeal to ORG , taking the view that such a remedy was available only in respect of points of law . On DATE they brought their case before the ORG .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , the applicants had addressed a letter on DATE to ORG , seeking payment of the sum awarded by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants served formal notice on ORG to pay the sum in question , then applied for a garnishee order ( pignoramento presso terzi ) .
CARDINAL . The sum awarded by ORG was paid on DATE .
